document_title: Dilated cardiomyopathy: Causes, signs, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
According to MSc. Huynh Thanh Kieu, the early stages of dilated cardiomyopathy may not show any symptoms. As the disease progresses, the patient will develop symptoms similar to those of heart failure, including: (3)
Difficulty breathing, shortness of breath, especially during exertion; Swollen feet, weight gain and increased waist circumference; High blood pressure; Fast pulse, irregular heartbeat; Distended neck veins; Wheeze; Dizziness and fainting; Anxiety, palpitations; Cerebral infarction is caused by a blood clot from the heart traveling to the brain; Chest pain; Fatigue, inability to exercise or perform normal activities.
Fatigue, chest tightness, and difficulty breathing are common symptoms in patients
